p: The present study is aiming to ameliorate these previous research results on the adverse effects of invasive molecules, through the investigation of their ecosystem availability. Consequently, Nicotiana glauca Graham ( N. glauca, Solanaceae), whose nectar contains nicotine like alkaloids, was selected as a focal point. N. glauca is a fast-growing shrub or small tree native to South America that has been introduced in North America, Europe, and Asia, consisting thus an IAS of global expansion [ 16]. Although hummingbirds pollinate N. glauca in its native range [ 17], bees and other insects have been observed to visit its flowers and impale the base of the corolla to access its nectar (Fig.Â 1).
